meanings.definition: To make something ready or prepared.
meanings.sent1: She reddied the table for dinner by setting out plates and silverware.
meanings.sent2: He always reddies his backpack the night before school to save time in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel reddied its nest with extra leaves, making it cozy for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The chef reddied the ingredients, turning them into a delicious meal in no time.
meanings.sent5: The team reddied themselves for the big game by practicing hard all week.

meanings.sent1: Her speech was reddier than mine, as she had rehearsed it many times.
meanings.sent2: The new car model is reddier for long road trips with its improved fuel efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked reddier than usual with its fur groomed and shiny.
meanings.sent4: The students were reddier for the exam after studying diligently all week.
meanings.sent5: The house felt reddier with all the repairs and renovations completed.
